11 on the California coast, the center of all economic activity, the nervous system of capital

when you think of a feed algorithm, there are many intelligent loops operating there. there is the actual model inference layer, which looks at the recent things you clicked on and the freshest items in the inventory to make microsecond decisions for what to show you

there‚Äôs the ML outer loop layer, where scientists actually do work to try new algorithms and see how they perform in live A/B tests and offline metrics. when they do so, they are changing a dataflow and continuous training process rather than just training 1 new model

then there‚Äôs the automatic training layer- companies instrument giant dataflow pipelines of input features and user engagements and retrain models *daily*. freshness of models makes sure that you‚Äôre as on distribution as possible. cursor says they‚Äôre launching new models *hourly*

it‚Äôs all a continuum and an OODA loop optimized over many layers a
of abstraction that approximate the recent calls for ‚Äúcontinual learning‚Äù. these ‚Äúclassic‚Äù ML systems that create trillions in revenue are worth thinking about more deeply re the nature of useful intelligence
